scripts.help:
echo '
=== RapidoBackup Console Scripts ===
ðŸš€ Development:
  dev: Start development server with API generation
  preview: Preview production build locally

ðŸ—ï¸ Build:
  build: Build for production with TypeScript compilation
  webapp:build: Clean and build webapp

ðŸ”§ API Generation:
  api:generate: Generate TypeScript client from OpenAPI spec
  api:generate:if-changed: Generate only if API spec changed
  api:watch: Watch API spec and regenerate on changes

ðŸ§¹ Cleanup:
  clean-www: Clean static files
  cleanup: Clean all build artifacts
  api:clean: Clean generated API client

âš™ï¸ Services:
  services:up: Start Docker services (PostgreSQL + Redis)

ðŸ“‹ Code Quality:
  lint: Run ESLint on all files'
scripts.//dev: Start development server with conditional API generation
scripts.build: npm run api:generate:if-changed && tsc -b && vite build
scripts.//build: Build for production with TypeScript compilation and API generation
scripts.webapp:build: npm run clean-www && npm run webapp:build:dev --
scripts.//api:generate: Generate TypeScript client from OpenAPI specification
scripts.api:generate:if-changed: powershell -Command "& { if (Test-Path 'src/main/resources/openapi/api.yml') { $apiHash = (Get-FileHash 'src/main/resources/openapi/api.yml' -Algorithm MD5).Hash; $hashFile = '.api-hash'; if (!(Test-Path $hashFile) -or $apiHash -ne (Get-Content $hashFile -Raw -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue).Trim()) { Write-Host 'API spec changed, regenerating client...'; npm run api:generate; $apiHash | Out-File $hashFile -NoNewline } else { Write-Host 'API spec unchanged, skipping generation.' } } else { Write-Host 'API spec not found, skipping generation.' } }"
scripts.//api:generate:if-changed: Generate API client only if OpenAPI spec has changed (MD5 hash check)
scripts.//api:watch: Watch OpenAPI spec file and regenerate client on changes
scripts.//services:up: Start PostgreSQL and Redis services via Docker Compose
scripts.//lint: Run ESLint on all TypeScript and JavaScript files
scripts.//prepare: Setup Git hooks with Husky (runs on npm install)
